subject: Curlin (Race Horse)
Horses
lead_paragraph: Ownership of Curlin, the reigning Horse of the Year, remained divided after a judge’s surprise ruling rejected a proposed sale that would have consolidated control of the horse under Jess Jackson. Jackson’s Stonestreet Stables owns 80 percent of Curlin, the richest North American racehorse in history. It had offered $4 million to buy out the remaining 20 percent interest from William Gallion and Shirley Cunningham Jr., who are under a court order to pay $42 million to former clients they represented in a settlement over the diet drug fen-phen.
